tool_description: When critical systems fail or major incidents happen, SIGNL4 is the fastest way to alert your staff, engineers, IT admins and workers ‘in the field’. SIGNL4 helps to keep your mission-critical infrastructure and services running – from anywhere and anytime. Integrates with 100+ IT, business and IoT tools.
name: SIGNL4 – Critical Mobile Alerting
title: SIGNL4 – Critical Mobile Alerting

api_list.name: /alerts/{alertId}
api_list.description: Gets an alert by id.

required_parameters.name: alertId
required_parameters.description: Id of the requested Alert.

api_list.name: /users/{userId}/image
/teams/{teamId}/memberships

required_parameters.name: teamId
required_parameters.description: Team ID of team you want to request.

api_list.name: /users/{userId}
api_list.description: Returns a user object with details such as his email address and duty information.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description:
Identifier of the user to get. Use 'Me' to get information about the currently logged in user. This is not possible with an api key.
Can also be an email address of a user in the team or the unique id of an according user object.”

api_list.name: /teams/{teamId}/dutysummary

required_parameters.name: teamId
required_parameters.description: ID of the team the duty belongs to.

api_list.name: /scripts/inventory
api_list.description: Returns all available inventory scripts which can be added to a SIGNL4 subscription.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://signl4-critical-mobile-alerting.p.rapidapi.com/scripts/inventory"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "signl4-critical-mobile-alerting.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /alerts/{alertId}/attachments/{attachmentId}

required_parameters.name: attachmentId
required_parameters.description: Id of the attachment, that you want to retrieve.

required_parameters.name: alertId
required_parameters.description: Id of the alert that contains the wanted attachment.

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Optional parameter defining the wanted height of the picture that is retrieved.

optional_parameters.name: scale
optional_parameters.description:
Optional parameter defining whether it's wanted to scale the retrieved image. Default is set to
true.

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Optional parameter defining the wanted width of the picture that is retrieved.

are part of your team will be returned.

api_list.name: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/teams
/alerts/report
api_list.description:
Returns information about the occurred alert volume in different time periods as well as information about the
response behaviour (amount of confirmed and unhandled alerts) of your team members.

optional_parameters.name: userId
optional_parameters.description: User ID of the user for whom you want a report.

api_list.name: /users/{userId}/dutyStatus
api_list.description: Returns a object with duty information.

required_parameters.name: userId
required_parameters.description:
Identifier of the user to get. Use 'Me' to get information about the currently logged in user. This is not possible with an api key.
Can also be an email address of a user in the team or the unique id of an according user object.”
